title: hypocrites?
body:
which one is correct?

 we like to give players the chance to improve behavior before they are permanently banned.

One match can indeed lead an account to be permanently banned.

replies.body: what about for asking for something that wasn't a template reply by the support team and getting 3 from 3 different 'people'?

"like to" as in, assuming reform is not happening, or a player is a significant enough detriment to others, it is better to simply remove them from the community.

Instant permanent suspensions are reserved for things like cheating/scripting. Even in instant perma cases for excessive hate speech I've always seen at least two logs in the notification, usually three, and they don't happen very often.

Instant permas are reserved for those who know they are doing something very not ok but still actively chose to do so, which doesn't really speak well for them wanting to reform.
